description: The function is vulnerable to several types of attacks. Firstly, it does not properly validate the input (CWE-20), which can lead to SQL Injection (CWE-89) if the input is used in a SQL query. It can also lead to Cross-site Scripting (XSS) (CWE-79) if the input is rendered on a webpage without proper sanitization. Lastly, the function is vulnerable to Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF) (CWE-352) as it does not properly validate the CSRF token.
